args: Is this article primarily about a new action or announcement by the Trump administration/White House/Executive? Respond simply with "yes" or "no" . Education Dept. launches investigation into Maine over transgender policies The Education Department announced Friday that it was launching an investigation into a Maine high school and the state’s education agency, after a tense exchange between President Donald Trump and Maine Gov. Janet Mills (D) over transgender students. Earlier in the day, Trump warned during a session with the Republican Governor’s Association that Maine risks losing federal funding if it continues to allow transgender students to participate in girls’ sports, despite his executive order aiming to ban that. Mills responded: “We’re going to follow the law, sir. We’ll see you in court.” On Friday, the Education Department’s Office for Civil Rights announced an investigation. “Maine would have you believe that it has no choice in how it treats women and girls in athletics — that is, that it must follow its state laws and allow male athletes to compete against women and girls,” Craig Trainor, the Education Department’s acting assistant secretary for civil rights, said in a statement. “Let me be clear: If Maine wants to continue to receive federal funds from the Education Department, it has to follow Title IX.” Mills responded promptly saying the state was standing firm. “If the President attempts to unilaterally deprive Maine school children of the benefit of Federal funding, my Administration and the Attorney General will take all appropriate and necessary legal action to restore that funding and the academic opportunity it provides. The State of Maine will not be intimidated by the President’s threats,” Mills replied in a statement.
